description.narrative: All Hands has been in Dominica since Sept. 7, and is one of only two NGOs there with expertise in post-disaster clean up. The other group, Scientology Ministries, is slated to leave the country on Oct. 5. All Hands' activities have included physical clean-up: muck, gut, clearing paths, roads, digging or clearing drainage ditches. We have also acted as a consultant to various ministries in the government of Dominica, sharing our expertise in disaster assessment and management. At the moment we are in discussions regarding staying beyond our Oct. 17 depart date to help with the rebuilding process. We are also working on delivering non-food items; - laptops donated by Credit Suisse to the 22 damaged schools - medical supplies donated by Global Links - other items to be determined as partnerships develop

On August 27, 2015 Tropical Storm Erika hit the east side of Dominica in the Caribbean's Lesser Antilles. The storm dropped over 12 inches of water in 12 hours. Rivers and streams surged carrying boulders and debris destroying roads, bridges and land. The heavy rains disturbed mountain sides creating landslides engulfing homes. Two villages have been rendered uninhabitable, Petit Savanne and Dubique. The 700 residents will have to be relocated and 400 homes built to accommodate them. To add to the complexity of relief efforts, Tropical Storm Grace followed on Sept. 15 and 16th, causing more mudslides and cutting off access to some affected areas by compromising more roads and breaking the newly constructed temporary bridges.
